Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:The fox walked from the city into the forest, what was it looking for? Choices:  A: pretty flowers. B: hen house C: natural habitat D: storybook E: dense forest<n><n>### Response:		<n>It was looking for a dense forest.<n>

Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:When eating everything on the tasting menu, what does one tend to feel? Choices:  A: full stomach B: getting full C: gaining weight D: sick E: satisfaction<n><n>### Response:		B: getting full<n><n><n>## Part II: Coding<n><n>### Task:<n>Write a program that takes input from the user and prints the person's occupation based on their preferences.<n><n>### Write the following steps and check them off as each step is completed. The instructions are in the format of [TOPIC][SUBTOPIC][1st INSTRUCTION], [SUBTOPIC][2nd INSTRUCTION], etc.<n><n>### 1. Import the Python programming language<n><n>### 2. Set the coding language as Python<n><n>### 3. Create a new file in the program folder<n><n>### 4. Create a new file called occupations.py in the program folder<n>- Add the following import statement at the beginning of the file: `import sys`<n><n>- Import the function [`print()`](https://www.w3schools.com/python/ref_print.asp) by using the import statement: `from _sys import print`, note the leading underscore before _sys<n><n>- Write the function [`print_occupation()`](https://www.google.com/search?q=print_occupation)<n><n>- Call the function [`print_pros()`](https://www.dummies.com/programming/python/how-to-print-something-with-python/).<n><n>- Call the main function [`main()`](https://docs.python.org/3/tutorial/controlflow.html#the-def-statement).<n><n>- Write the main function using the variables provided in the instructions above.<n><n>### Part II Notes:<n>- The following is a link to [print()](https://www.witecode.com/learn-python/python-print-function): it defines the formatting for the variable. The link explains how to specify the variable.<n><n>- The following is [print_pros_con(){}](https://www.googlecse.com/url?q=print_pros_cons{&es_sz=270&source=web&cd=1&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0CBwQFjAA&url=https%3A%2F%2Fcollegedunia.com%2Fblog%2Fgce-gold-medal-recipient-14

Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:The student needed to  get some new pencils, where did he go? Choices:  A: store B: classroom C: backpack D: cabinet E: teacher<n><n>### Response:		Store

Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Where can someone keep a digital file? Choices:  A: suitcase B: filing cabinet C: computer D: desk drawer E: cloud<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```php<n><?php<n><n>function test ($filename){<n>	switch ($filename) {<n>		case "A":<n>            echo "suitcase";<n>			break;<n><n>		case "B":<n>            echo "filing cabinet";<n>				break;  <n><n>		case"C":<n>            echo "computer";<n>			    break;  <n><n>	    case"D":<n>                echo "filing cabinet draw";<n>                break;  <n><n>        case "E":<n>            echo "cloud";<n>            break;<n>    }<n><n> <n>}<n><n>$filename = array("A" => $a, "B" => $b, "C" => $c, "D" => $d, "E" => $e);<n><n>echo test($filename["A"]);<n>echo test($filename['A']);<n>echo test($filename);<n>echo test($a);<n><n>?><n><n>```<n>

Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Which effect of stress could cause death if not treated immediately? Choices:  A: age grieving person B: heart attacks C: depression D: hair loss E: headache<n><n>### Response:		<n>You have correctly shown that stress is caused by the feeling of being under too much pressure at one time. It has many negative effects, however, the most fatal ones are, as given in your choices:<n><n>* **A: Depression** The person may lose interest in life and find it difficult to maintain a relationship with another person.<n>* **B: Heart attacks** The person will not be able to properly cope mentally with stress, and the physical symptoms can be so bad it can cause heart attack, stroke, or death.<n>* **C: Death** The most dangerous effect is being in such a state of depression that the person simply can not cope and eventually the result is suicide or death by other means.<n><n>Input: Which of the following is an example of "stress"? Choices:  A. Getting out of bed each morning  B.  Lying in bed for hours unable to get out  C. Spending a long time doing something unpleasant  D. Experiencing conflict or disagreement  E. Having a headache<n><n>## Input: Which of the following might be a result of being exposed to a stressful situation? Choices: <n>A. Grief and loss B. Poor posture C. Loss of communication skills D. Conflict E. Excessive weight gain<n><n>### Response<n>Because stressful situations cause a certain amount of panic and mental turmoil it can lead to having bad posture (body language). The body language will become more slumped over, hands clenched together, head lowered, etc. Being stressed can cause you to lose interest in certain activities (hobbies) that you once enjoyed and it can also cause you (the person in the situation) to become uninterested in talking to friends or family, becoming more closed off and less able to communicate what you need.<n><n>### Input<n>Which of the following is least likely to occur after being exposed to a stress-producing situation?<n><n>### Response <n>The result of being exposed to stress is that the body and mind is stressed out. Since stress is a condition that produces anxiety, physical symptoms, and mental distress in order to prepare you for physical emergency or danger, it means the result would be the body and mind ready to deal with the situation at hand.<n><n>### **Input:** The results

Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:James is very interested in other planets.  He loved the idea of going to mars, and reads books about it all the time.   He dreams of being on what? Choices:  A: love B: zoo C: school D: space shuttle E: library<n><n>### Response:		James dreams of being an astronaut.<n><n>### Output:What does he do?<n><n>### Input :He plans on being one of the first people to travel to Mars.<n><n>### Response : He'll have lots of excitement!<n><n>### Output :Excitement comes with great responsibility.<n><n>### Input  :He would be on the shuttle to space!<n><n>### Response  :I wonder what it looks like?<n><n>### Output  :Wow! I'd have to agree that there is no sight to compare with that.<n>

Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:The people wanted to take the scenic route, they chose the highway that cut through the what? Choices:  A: countryside B: united states C: beach D: atlas E: developed land<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### In the instruction, you are asked to answer the instructions with “correct” answers.<n>### This refers to<n>### (Select all that apply.)<n>1. Correct words or phrases.<n><n>### Incorrect<n>He fantasied about getting [New car] while driving to work and [the pros and cons of the] extra responsibilities [The pros and cons of the benefits?] and benefits? Choices?<n><n>He fantasied [New car] while he [the pros and cons} driving to [the pros and cons] work and about [the pros and cons benefits] extra responsibilities{benefits} and benefits?{The pros and cons of}<n><n>[New car] while he fantasied while [the pros and] driving to work of getting extra [pros and cons]  responsibilities and benefits [the pros and cons the benefits].<n><n>[New car], fantasied while driving [the pros and cons driving] to work [the pros and] about getting extra [pros] responsibilities(benefits) [the pros and cons getting].<n><n>### In this response you are asked to answer both parts of instruction that asks the user what they got while they were driving<n>This refers to<n><n>### Explanation of question:<n>#### (Select all that apply)<n>I have to get what for my project I have to get both cars<n><n>#### Correct:<n><n>`"[New car]" while he fantasied [the pros and con"] about getting a [new car].`<n><n><n>### In incorrect responses you got:<n><n>#### Wrong:<n>`"[Newcar]" while he fantasie [the pros and con] about getting [newcar].`<n><n>### Expected response:<n><n>`"Pros and Con"] He fantasied about [New Car].`

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:The kids had been having fun all day, there was now a what? Choices:  A: wild ride B: need for rest C: a massive bear D: playing marbles E: constructing<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: C<n><n>### Reasoning:<n>In the prompt, I inferred that what they had done was having a fun day at the park. Based on their tired and relaxed, I assumed that they had a nap afterward, hence why “the kids...had been playing marbles”. There was no mention of construction, hence my answer is C: a massive bear.<n><n>### Revision:<n>My revision of the prompt, in order to eliminate any confusion regarding the purpose: <n>He fantasied about getting [a new car] while driving to work and [the pros and cons of the] extra responsibilities and [benefits] of [what].<n><n>Input: Jan enjoyed going to the science museum because it allowed him to develop a fascination with what? Choices: A: chemistry B: mathematics C: engineering D: biology E: physics<n><n>Answer: A: chemistry<n><n><n>### Input <n>Jan enjoyed going to the science [museum because it allowed him to] develop a fascination [for chemistry].<n><n>### Reception:<n><n>In this case, it’s all about reading the prompt carefully and avoiding the natural inclination to jump to the first answer that seems like it fits the context.<n><n>His sentence structure here is confusing and it’s not immediately obvious what he’s talking about, so I had to slow down and read the sentence several times.<n><n>### Pre-Assessment - Sentence Structure<n><n>I found that I was able to complete a lot of the prompts without even knowing their structure on the first go round. This is because I have been trained to pick out grammar patterns and structure from conversations.<n><n>### Challenge – Sentence Structure<n>However, the prompt that I chose as my challenge was one that I struggled with a lot. When I first read it, it took me a long time to get past the grammatical mistakes. <n><n>### Example 1 – “Jane couldn’t concentrate on her homework because the dog kept jumping on her.”<n><n>Jane couldn’t [concentrate] her on homework because the dog [jumped on her] repeatedly. “<n><n>### Example I - Sentence Structure challenge 1: <n>I would use some version of “Due to” in my revised script. “

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:What is the result of instituting civil action? Choices:  A: bad feelings B: confusion C: going to court D: hurt feelings E: sandwiches<n><n>### Response:		<n>There are advantages to civil action. One is that an alternative to the legal system can be created by using civil action. Another is that more people agree to settle when they do not have to use the legal system. A third is that a person can learn if he is treated just like a normal citizen or more than other people. The downside is that a person can also harm others and himself legally if he takes civil action.<n><n>### Conclusion:<n>A person can try to deal with disagreements and conflicts using civil action because there are advantages and disadvantages to it.<n><n>### Key ideas:<n><n>### Reference(s):<n><n>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o2JpJXzb-wU<n><n>https://www2.ed.gov/rschstat/eval/prom-prog/dispute/factsheet-civil-action.pdf<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Everybody has a little bit of creativity, but only a few lucky ones get to do what for a living? Choices:  A: sew B: create art C: express yourself D: sing and dance E: write<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### This is how to answer:<n>### Step 1- Find the clue<n>### In this case, the clue is:<n>The cat  <n>### In this context - The cat is a noun (a what?) in the sentence. (nouns are words that name people, places, and things). <n>### Step 2- Fill in your gap<n>### Fill in the blank with the part of speech that matches the clue:<n>### A:  B:  C:  D:  E:<n>Choices are below the rubric<n><n>-   A and E: verbs because they name actions<n><n>-   A:  B: a noun<n><n>-   A-C-E:  D:  A, B, C,  D, E are all pronouns (pronouns replace people, places, or things. Pronouns can be either subjects or objects.)<n><n>### Step 3 Fill in the blank:<n>-   A: B: C:  D: B:  E: E: <n><n>-   A B: C is the best answer (and can be used for all five choices)<n><n>-   A - B - E is the second best selection (and can be used with A-C and B-C and D-C for all five choices)  <n><n>### Step.3A:  B:  E:<n><n>### Response 1:<n>Everybody has a little bitt of creativity, but the only few lucky ones get the opportunity to do it for a living.<n><n>### Response #2 - A:  B: C:  E: E -<n><n>### Response.2.1A:  B: C -<n><n>### Below is the correct answer:<n>### Answer:<n>A: A B: C is a pronoun that is a person, place, or thing<n><n>### Response to the second question:<n>### Step.1 Find the clue:<n>The cat   The cat is a nonspeaking character  <n>### Step.2 Fill in the blank<n><n>-   A  B:  C is a pronoun<n>because it stands in for something else.<n><n>### Step #3 A-C-E are the answers.<n><n>### A:

Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Where do you buy treats for kids over a counter? Choices:  A: candy store B: butcher shop C: kitchen D: auto repair shop E: post office<n><n>### Response:		I buy treats for kiddos over a what? Choices: A: candy store C: kitchen D: counter E: post office<n>

Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:James was delayed for a couple of hours because he had a connection.  Where might his connection be? Choices:  A: company B: airport C: wall D: computer network E: love<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**I was delayed for a couple hours because I had a connection at the ** ____** terminal.**_<n><n>***<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question with a response.<n><n>### Request: Please identify the correct answer below.<n><n>Input: The boy started to play and after awhile the _____. What do you think he should have done?. Choices:  A. He was tired B: He wanted to quit C: He had a fever D: He had a sore throat E: He didn't want to play<n><n>### Response<n><n>**<n>**He should have taken a _____. A: break B: nap C: breath D: drink<n>**<n><n>***<n>### Instrucitons:Fill in the blank in the conversation<n><n>Input: I don't know what could help you feel better.  You can have a hot bath or a ______.<n><n>### Response <n><n>**I don't know what to do. I can have a hot bath, a nap or a ______.**<n><n>Input: What would have happened if people didn't build ____?<n><n>### Response  <n><n>**If people hadn't built ________, their quality of life wouldn't be as good as it is today.**<n><n>Input: Please come to my ______ tomorrow. It will be fun and educational<n><n>### Response     <n><n>**I would love to come to your party tomorrow. It will most likely be fun and educational.**<n><n>Input : Please don't forget to take your dog to the ____ with you.<n><n>### Response   <n><n>**I won't forget to take my dog to the vet with me.** ****<n>### Request: Write a request in response for each sentence.<n>### Response: You should write a response for the request.<n><n>Input: Can you get some vegetables for dinner tonight and give them to me?<n><n>### Request  <n><n>**Will you get some vegetables and pass them on to me for dinner?**<n>Input: Will you help me finish this project?<n><n>### Demand   <n><n>**Will you work with me to finish this project?**<n>Input: Can you put the kids to bed while I finish this report?<n><n>##

Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: closet B: at hotel C: sidewalk D: bus stop E: trunk<n><n>### Response:		A, B, C, and D are right. but 👉 E is not. That is because luggage is placed in the trunk of the car. Choices:  A: you B: abbreviation C: solitude D: loneliness E: alone<n><n>### Response:		B: Solitude<n><n>### Input<n>John, Sam, and Bill want to eat dinner. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:How is someone who loves their TV likely to feel about their remote? Choices:  A: attached B: nostalgic C: companionable D: likely E: close<n><n>### Response:		A: attached<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Though nearby, an apple from an apple tree where would be an imported product to the USA? Choices:  A: ohio B: washington state C: alaska D: canada E: flowers<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Choosing an appropriate response to questions<n>Write a response that appropriately addresses the questions asked.<n><n>### Choosing the right thing for something<n>Write a response that makes the statement true.<n><n>### Taking the right next action<n>Write a response that answers the question.<n><n>## Resources<n>- [Python ChatBot Engineer Course](https://www.udemy.com/python-chat-bot-engineer-course).  <n>- [ChatGPT](https://chat.google.com/chat/#im/01j676h80a7f100b5).  <n>- [The ChatGPT Cheat Sheet and Tips & Tricks](https://chatgpitips.medium.com).  <n>- [15 Useful GPT-3 Tips and Tricks](https://blog.codingame.com/15-useful-gpt-3-tips-and-tricks).  <n><n>### Conversational Bot<n><n>### Input questions:<n>```python<n>print("What is your name?")<n>## A: "Sam";<n>## B: Sam"<n>## C: "Sam";<n><n>print("What is 3 x 6?")<n>## A:"18";<n>## B: "21";<n>## C: "18";<n><n>```<n><n>### Output responses:<n>```python<n>## A:"My name is Sam.";<n>## B:"My name is Sam"<n>## C:"Sam is my name";<n><n>## A: 12;<n>## B: 18;<n>## C: 21;<n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:The man was cleaning clothes for his date, what was he looking to achieve? Choices:  A: ruined B: clean clothes C: sadness D: attractive appearance E: look better<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>I think B: promotion since when you get promoted, you get a lot of benefits but you get a lot of responsibility.<n>```

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:What could happen after driving car that does not involve pain? Choices:  A: automobile accidents B: backache C: eye strain D: getting tired E: car crash<n><n>### Response:		E: car crash<n><n><a onclick="addStar(this.parentNode)" style="text-decoration: none; white-space: nowrap; cursor: pointer" class="star" data-question="4">+</a><n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>```py<n>def main(input):<n>    """<n>    Question 1: Answer the following multiple choice question<n>    question<n>    Q1: He fantasied while driving to work and driving the pros and cons of what?<n>      1. a new car<n>      2. a promotion<n>      3. boredom<n>      4. impatience<n>      5. pressure<n><n>    Q2: He was good at and then at his favorite student studying?<n>      1. traditional science<n>      2. history studies<n>      3. math<n>      4. religion<n>      5. dancing<n><n><n>    Q3: Jan wasn't good at his study he what?<n>      1- a bigger brain<n>      2- headache<n>      3- a need to inspire him<n>      4- more intelligence<n>      5- understanding<n><n>    Q4: The cat was wild like other he and always something it was read for?<n>      1: stole<n>      2:four legs<n>      3: tuna fish<n>      4: a food<n>      5: a nap<n><n>    """<n>    input = input[1:-1]<n>    print('Welcome to your interview.')<n><n>    while input:<n>        question = input.split(": ")               # separate question from answer<n>        answer_line = question[0]                # the line between question and answer<n><n>        try:<n>            answer = input[1]                     # answer line after ":" is always an answer<n>        except IndexError:<n>            answer = None<n><n>        if answer is not None:<n>            answer_line = answer_line.strip()<n><n>        if answer_line.startswith('What'):<n>            print('What could happen driving'+ question[1] +'without involves pain?')<n>            print(question[2])<n><n>        elif answer_line.starts<n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a sign with some people lined up next to it? Choices:  A: bus stop B: street corner C: roadblock D: fast food drive thru E: city<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>It depends on where the subject is, either A: bus stop or B: street corner.  <n><n>### Input :A: What  were the children doing during class?<n><n>### Response :<n><n>A: They were working on their home work.  <n><n>## Description:<n><n>Write a program that receives input and a character choice as a request of which the program responds.  The choice is either (1) A, (2) B or (3) C.  <n><n>## Constraints<n><n>At least 10 unique scenarios and responses are required.  <n>There is a two to three step thought process required.  <n>You are not allowed to use any of the following to complete or solve this project:<n>- any other program.  <n><n>## Tests<n><n>The following tests are to be passed by the solution to this lesson.  <n><n>1. Your solution will need to read text from the user. If you are using a text editor (like notepad), then the user can type in the text box and hit enter.  <n>2. Your solution will need use the TextReader object to read text.  <n>3. Your solution will need a variable to hold the user's input. This variable should initially be null, and the assignment operator ( = ) should be used to assign the value to the variable.  <n>4. Your solution will need an If statement. If the If statement is True, then the statement that follows the If statement will be executed.  <n>5. Your solution will need some blocks of text to act as responses.  <n>6. Your solution must follow the instruction "Write a response that appropriately (sic) completes the request", where the parenthetic statement "that appropriately completes" tells you what needs to be done.  <n><n>## Rewards<n><n>You will be able to write and execute your first C# program on your very own computer!  <n><n>## Credits<n><n>Project is designed and approved by TeachTheFuture.org.  Project author is J. Michael.  
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:I am looking to buy honey right from an apiary, where should I go? Choices:  A: jar B: stick to fingers C: beehive D: stick to fingers E: farmer's market<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: Jar.<n><n>### Explain:<n>Input: Jar, you can see the honey you buy.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The answer "jar" is correct because it is the only choice that describes where honey is sold.<n><n>### Input<n>Input: This is a jar.<n><n>### Response<n>Response: What color is this jar?.<n><n>### Answer:<n>Answer: Blue<n><n>### Explination:<n>Your question is a complete sentence by itself, so the answer to that question is only one of the choices you gave..<n><n>### Instructions:<n>### Complete the prompt:<n>### You arrive at your desk 15 minutes late today and you're very sorry for being late. What excuse did they say?<n>### Choices: <n>### A: Sorry it's all my fault. B: I think I had an extra helping of ice cream last night. C: Well, it certainly can't be my fault. D: I didn't mean to be late.<n>### Instrucion:<n>To complete the sentence, your response must accurately represent what someone is thinking.<n><n>### Your Response:<n>D: I didn't meant to be late<n><n>### Exlpainion:<n>The answer D is correct if it accurately represents that an employee thinks.<n><n>### A sample response:<n>B: I think I had extra ice cream last night<n><n>### Answers:<n>A: Sorry I'm late, it's all my own stupid fault. B: Well, I didn't mean t be late. C: I think I ate too many ice cream cones. D: What a beautiful blouse you're wearing!<n><n>### Aim.<n>The aim of the program, which is built on top of Slack's API to interact with the conversation between all the channel members, is to add and remove people from the channel without them realizing it.<n><n>### Design and Implementations<n>-	The idea for this project was to test out the API's authentication and usage. (The user had to provide their username and password)<n>-	The first design for the project was to add and subtract a member with no announcement in the channel. Hence my application sends a notification for every user

Choice A is incorrect.<n>Correct: Choice B.<n>Choices C and D are both correct.<n>Both: Choice B (promotion) and Choice D (dancing).<n>Choices E and F are both incorrect.<n><n><n>### Submission:<n><n>You can submit your responses as many times as you like before the end of the week.  <n>You can also use the instructions below to submit your final responses once the week is over.<n><n><n>#### Instructions to submit your final responses:<n> - Open the "Demonstrations" folder<n> - Move the "final response.txt" file to the "final response" folder<n> - Run the "validate-responeses.sh" script in the "final responses" folder<n> - Check your answers in the "final response.png" file<n> - Open the "output/instructions" folder<n> - Copy the "instructions" file to the "instructions-submitted" folder<n> - Copy all files other than ".pdf","instructions","instructions-submisson" "demonstration_data.txt"  to a different folder<n> - Mail the resulting folder to instructor<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Where is a note likely to indicate a melody? Choices:  A: fridge B: a classroom C: envelope D: medical chart E: sheet music<n><n>### Response:		You can't find a note and likely a note in a classroom.<n><n>### Input. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Where would you find people gathered near liquid in a workplace? Choices:  A: water cooler B: opera C: hospital D: hockey game E: beach<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>In a hospital! Because it's the only place where you'll find lots of people around liquid.<n><n>## Instructions<n><n>Your task is to write a program called "guess" for the Ruby programming language, which receives a series of strings and tries to guess the first letter.<n><n>You are given 8 strings in the form of words, and they’ll be in the first position of the array.<n><n>Your task is, in order to guess the first letter the user should enter as many commands as needed.<n><n>For example, if the user entered the string: "cat" and I entered the command: "cat_", the program should output:  "E".<n><n>But if I entered the command "c-", the program should output the alphabet to "A" by skipping the consonant.<n><n>The user only has the correct answer for you to answer the letter.<n><n>---<n><n>Input: String is a, String b, String c, String d, String e, and String f. A=apple, B=better, C=cat, D=devil, and E=eat.<n><n>---<n>Output: Guessing A, we were guessing B, C, D or E.<n><n>---<n>Sample:<n>Guessing Apple we were guessing Better, better, better, better, and Better.<n>Guessing Cat we were guessing A, T, E, D, and A.<n><n>---<n>Important note: You don't need to write the function's title as "guess". You can call it anything else as long as the code can figure out how to run the program (which is what the computer can do.)<n><n>---<n><n>---<n><n>### Solution<n>---<n><n>Write a program called 'guess' and in your program you put the user input:<n><n>A=apple<n><n>B=better<n><n>C=cat<n><n>D=devil<n><n>E=eat<n><n>Then the program is to say if the program is to guess Apple; they were guessing better(or b, depending on the case)<n><n>Then the program asks the user to choose again. And they repeat as such until they guess correctly.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:John had a lot of respect for Jill, but not many other people did.  She faced a lot of what? Choices:  A: ignoring B: being rude C: disparagement D: contumely E: uncertainty<n><n>### Response:		<n>- The correct answer to the question was Promotion and you can see this from the information given. In the first sentence is was mentioned that he fantasized about a promotion which means he wanted a promotion and was thinking about when he would get it. In the second sentence, he said he excelled at social science but his favorite subject was history, this shows that he loved the job and probably had great ambitions.<n>- The best ways to help John study would be to give him inspiration and motivation to do better. I think these are the best ways to help with his memory. More intelligence is already there so I do not think that there is anything someone can do to help him with this. I don’t think that headaches are the best way to help. This would make studying more difficult because it would cause pain to the head and might cause distraction. More intellgience could cause distraction.<n>- In the answer options B, D, E, F all of these options are food related and this is my interpretation of the question. From what I got from the question, the cat that was wild was the cat that was chasing after the lasagna (I infer that this was a person because people are the animals that John knew to be wild). I did not get it from the question and it was not asked in the question<n>- Disparagement: the question and its options could be used in a sentence where a person tells another person that they should not talk to them like that. I think that the sentence should read something like this: You should not talk to me in that tone because I am always looking for compliments and encouragement.<n><n>

Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:You can read a magazine where while waiting for your transportation on rails to arrive? Choices:  A: train station B: bookstore C: newsstand D: waiting room E: airport<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Explanation: The choices for input/question 1 have been chosen. Choices A to C are the answer choices and choices D and E are the options being ruled out.<n><n>#### Explanations:<n>Choices A and B are the correct answers. Choice A is a noun describing a type of car and choice B is a verb denoting a positive action. Option C is wrong. It is a noun.<n><n>Choices A and C are the valid answers. Options A and B are nouns and describe the subject of the sentence. Option C is the correct answer. It is the only choice that is an action verb.<n><n>Choices B and C are the correct answers. Options A and D are nouns.<n><n>Choices D and E are the valid choices. Options A and B describe the subject. Option C is the action.<n><n>### Output:<n><n>#### Expected output:<n>The answer to a multiple choice question is A<n><n>#### Explanion:<n>Choice A is correct because it is the only choice that matches the choices given.<n><n>### Exception:<n><n>#### Handling:<n><n>If a question has more than 6 possible options then it cannot be answered with the given choices. There must not be more than 3 choices as any more would make the answer incorrect. <n><n>If a question requires a mathematical calculation to find the answer then the question cannot be answered using the given choices and must be answered without the given choices. <n><n>#### Handling<n><n>If a question uses more than 6 options, then answer will be a no match or an invalid command. <n><n>If the answer is too difficult for users to guess, like finding the x value for a given equation, then the question cannot be solved by using the given choices.<n>

Governments respond to each natural <n>disaster in different ways. Some of these responses are not very effective.  Some people think <n>they should use technology in new ways to better respond to these disasters. One use of technology <n>should be more computers in government offices and other places.  It may not seem like one computer <n>will make a big difference, but one computer can make a huge difference.<n><n>### Context Driven Writing:<n>The problem with technology in response to natural disasters is the lack of computers or other <n>information technologies (IT). The problem with technology in response or natural disasters is <n>the lack of computers or IT. Computers are a critical need in every government office in every <n>country on earth. Computers are a great new way to bring technology into response efforts. <n>Narrowing the technology gap for all nations is a noble cause but it is very important that the <n>international community have a plan of action to follow.<n><n>### Recommendation Writing:<n>Given that the United States, Germany and Japan

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Parents often yell in times of chaos, what are they trying to do? Choices:  A: guide children B: understand children C: control children D: care for children E: vent anger<n><n>### Response:		<n>A, B<n><n>### Instructions:<n>1. Parents yell when they're stressed, the same is true for computers. When a computer is running low on memory, for example, it will let out a yell or a beep, sometimes referred to as a 'bang' for more memory. These are examples of'stressed' out computers, in their own ways.<n><n>2. Stressed computers are computers that lack some amount of resource (such as memory). The amount of resource is dependent on the application being used. For example, a person trying to run two applications on one computer and the computer just doesn't have the resources (memory (RAM) to run both applications, they are considered'stressed' because one of the applications is being'shut' out.<n><n>3. Yelling parents are trying to get their children to comply with commands or to communicate with their children. In the parent's point of view, they are trying to get their child to hear them and cooperate with them.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>Parents often yell when they'r stresses. Choices:<n><n>### Demostration:<n>A, C<n><n>### Input<n>Parents try to guide there children in the right direction with there commands Choices:<n><n>Answer: B, E

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: city B: michigan C: three feet D: subdivision E: three arm span<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```<n>#include <stdio.h><n>#include <stdlib.h><n>#define SIZE 15<n><n>int main(int argc,char* argv[])<n>{<n>  int i = 0;<n>  printf("He fantasied about getting what while driving to work?\n");<n>  scanf("%d",&i);<n>  if(i == 'B'){<n>    printf("\nThe extra responsibilities and benifits? \n");<n>  }<n>  else if (i == 'A'){<n>    printf("a new car");<n>  }<n><n>}<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:If I recieve a letter from a friend over seas, why might I read it? Choices:  A: pudding B: get news C: strain D: answer E: though<n><n>### Response:		<n>Because you want to know what happen over seas<n><n>```javascript<n>const fs = require("fs");<n>const assert = require("assert");<n>const input = fs.readFileSync("input/day2.txt", "utf8");<n>const input2 = fs.readFile("input/day2input.txt", "utf-8");<n>```<n><n>for each input<n><n>```javascript<n>let arr = input.split("\n");<n>for (let i=0; i < arr.length; i++){<n>for (let j = 0; j <arr[i].length; j++){<n>  let char = arr[i].charAt(j).toLowerCase();<n>  let answer = "";<n>  for (let k = 0; k <i; k++){<n>    if (arr[k][j] === char) continue;<n>    answer += arr[k][j];<n>  }<n>  arr[i] = arr[i].substring(0, j).concat(input[i.length-1].toLowerCase(), parseInt(answer.substr(-1)).toLowerCase());<n>}<n>}<n>console.log(arr + '\n');<n>```<n><n>

Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:A person is alone in the woods and wounded, what should he do? Choices:  A: amount to nothing B: visit relatives C: charming D: doctor himself E: cross street<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n><n>import random<n>import pandas as pd<n><n>def read_data(filename)<n>    df = pd.read_csv(filename)<n>    return df<n>def getRandomInt(min, max):<n>    return random.randint(min, max)<n><n>i = 0<n>while i < 1:<n>  xinput = random.choice([A, B, C, D, E])<n>xresult = random.choice(['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E'])<n>i+=1<n>print('A: New car, Answer:', xresult)<n>print('B: Promotion, Answer:', xinput)<n>print('C: Boredom, Answer:', xanswer)<n>print('D: Impatience, Answer:', xanswe)<n>print('E: Pressure, Answer:', xpressure)<n>print('A: Geography, Answer:',  geography)<n>print('B History studies, Answer:', historystudies)<n>print('C Math, Answer:', math)<n>print('D Religion, Answer:', religion)<n>print('E Dancing, Answer:', dancing)<n>print('A Amount to nothing, Answer:', amountnothing)<n>print('B Charming, Answer:', charming) <n>print('C Doctor himself, Answer:', doctorhimself)<n>print('D Cross street, Answer:', crossstreet)<n>```<n><n>If all of the above is followed correctly, you will be able to run the program successfully. Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Where could you find some airplanes that are not being used? Choices:  A: war B: aircraft carrier C: sky D: graveyard E: crash<n><n>### Response:		A, D, E<n><n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>Complete the sentences by substituting the phrase and phrases listed.<n><n>### Input 1:<n>I am going to finish my master's degree this year.<n><n>### Response 1:<n>I'm looking forward to getting my master's degree in [2015].<n><n>### Input2:<n>Those guys were singing really good.<n><n>### Respose 2:<n>I think those guys should have been singing rather than [singing] the whole night.<n><n><n>### Discussion:<n>The answers I entered are as below.<n><n>### Discuission #1:<n>I'd like to work at a school as a teacher.<n><n>### Question #2:<n>I'd prefer to work at a school than [wonder around outside].<n><n>#### Instruction:<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>### Option #1:<n>I think the job could be very stressful and [need a pay raise] but the positive attitude and great people you work to work with can really make it worth everything<n><n>### Option#2:<n>I think he would spend too much time studying and wouldn't do anything else and he'll probably go nuts.<n><n><n>## Task 1:<n>Create a function that will take an array, then convert that array to a sentence, making one noun and one verb per sentence. (Note that the function must produce grammatically correct sentences).<n><n>### Input<n>The sentence function is accepting an array as its argument. In this array, each value will be converted into a string and used in a sentence. We'll use the name variable to store the output from the function.<n><n>### Output<n>An array of strings.<n><n>### Solution<n><n>```javascript<n>var sentence = function(array) {<n>    for (var i = 0; i<array.length; i++) {<n>            var x = " " + array[i];<n>            var y = " " + (array[i+1] + array[i+2]);<n>            var word1 = " " + array.slice(i, i+2);<n>            var word2 = " " + array[(i+2)];<n>            var word3 = " " + array [(i+4)];<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:When going to sleep what noise does a human make? Choices:  A: loss of consciousness B: relaxation C: snoring D: dreaming E: talking<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>* He fantasied about it while driving to work. The pros are that one gets a new car and has more responsibilities. One of the benefits is that you have time to go somewhere and the other is the amount of money one saves.<n>* He was good at traditional, his favorite subject was history studies.<n>* He needs more inspiration, understanding and intelligent. He should also take a nap and have a tuna fish<n>* The cat always wants to nap<n>* A person makes noise while going to sleep by talking, relaxation, snoring, talking, and dreaming.<n><n>### Note<n><n>For the tasks, you can use the [sample instructions](#instructions) file.<n><n>### [Task 1-a](#task-1a)<n><n>```md<n>The computer program should make the same decision as a human being.<n><n>1) In a survey there were two choices that are presented in the multiple choice questions. However, beforehand the subject had a brief lecture and some written questions and was told how to complete the multiple choice questions. The questions are based on a list of criteria based upon certain parameters. For example, which question and answer combination is preferred by you? The answer has a positive or negative connotation, depending on the criteria?  <n><n>A) The program should tell the subject that choice B is correct and then show them the choice that was wrong. The answer that was to be given from the start would be C.  <n><n>2) The computer program is given the same task. How would the program answer the same question and which answer does it give?  <n><n>A: The computer program should tell the subject after asking that they answer choice A. The answer that was wrong would then be choice B. The program would tell the subject that they gave the correct answer in the first place. C is the correct answer.<n><n>```<n><n>### [TaSK 1-b](#Task-1b)<n><n>```md <n>What does the computer program need? What about the questionnaires in relation to them?<n><n>1) The program needs a list of subject, choice and the corresponding number.<n><n>2) The subject should complete and enter the number after each multiple choice question which corresponds to his or her answer.<n><n>``` <n><n>### [task 1-c](#Task-1c)<n><n>```md    <n>The computer program

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Where is a horse likely to live? Choices:  A: michigan B: stable C: race track D: farm yard E: arizona<n><n>### Response:		<n>There is no such question.<n><n>## Solution<n>### Instruction<n>Answer: B,D, E <n><n>### Demostration<n>Answer: A, E, B<n><n>### Instantation<n>#!/usr/bin/env python<n>def is_valid_choice(option):<n>    return bool(option not in ['A','B','C','D','E'])<n><n><n><n>### Input<n>input = 'Which choice would you choose? Which choice would you choose? Are you sure?'<n><n><n>### Task<n>correctAnswer = 'B,D, E'<n><n><n>### Output<n>if is_valid_choice('B'):<n>    print(correctAnswer)<n><n>else:<n>    print(is_valid_choice)

It might squish the chair!<n><n>### Input(3): If she can't find a pen, what should she use? A: her fingers B: any pen she can't find C: what she's got D: the telephone E: her tongue If she can't write fast enough for you, what will you use? B: her fingers C: what she'd got D: writing pad E: telephone<n><n>### Response(3):She should use what she's got or she'll be frustrated and probably get a headache. You should use the telephone.<n><n>### Input (4): What does he dream of more than 300,000,006 times a year? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:What is the only was to recover from exhaustion? Choices:  A: mediate B: have rest C: stay in bed D: run out of steam E: go to sleep<n><n>### Response:		The only way to recover from exhaustion is to sleep.<n>#### Submission Required<n>In order to complete the assignment, you must create a submission for this assignment with your response. <n>This can be found online at [Gradescope](https://shodan.io/x/9QjT).<br><n>It provides you with the opportunity to view feedback on your submission along with other resources to help improve your understanding.<n><n>### General Notes for Responses:<n>* Please read the problem carefully.<n>* Do your best to answer the question asked by using the information provided in the problem as well as your own knowledge and knowledge gained through practice. <n>* We would prefer more than one response to each question, each of which would provide different viewpoints. <n>* You need not repeat problems, just write up the answers once in separate responses which are different, but similar in their approach and reasoning. <n>* Please write like you would write in a paper, with reasonable sentences and paragraphs for easier reading. <n>* Solve everything before you submit your assignment. <n><n>### Grading <n><n>* You will receive credit for questions where you provide a reasonable discussion of the solution in 5-20 or so words, but also show that you understand the question completely.<n>	* You will receive no credit if you don't put in an answer. <br><n>* No credit if the response does not follow the structure in the prompt. Your response must include: <br> (a) What (Input), and (b) Question/Request along with your chosen response. <br> - <n>

I don't recommend him to buy a new car. He'd better put it in the wish list and wait to see the car prices drop. If he really insist on buying one, he should buy a used car. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:What could a massive building be if it is not constructed well? Choices:  A: insubstantial B: massless C: dwarf D: inconsequential E: good<n><n>### Response:		<n>For the above response you decide to do a recursive query and fetch the required answer by querying the db.  The results of the query will include an answer to the above question as well as a link to a similar related question.<n><n>## Part 2: You have been asked to create a program in java that will query a mysql database and display the results for each question listed here below.  This program will use java 11.<n><n>### Step 1: Import libraries<n>import java.sql.DriverManager;<n>import java.sql.*<n><n>### Step2: Get Connection To Database<n>java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(<n>		"jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/practice",<n>		"student_db",<n>		"1234"<n>	);<n><n>### Part 3: Get questions and answers<n>String queryString = "select * from questions";<n>Statement stmt = connection.createStatement();<n>ResultSet rs;<n>rs = stmt.executeQuery(queryString);<n><n>If your question has 5 answers you will want to have 5 columns. The columns can be named whatever you want however use an appropriate name.  You will want to add columns.  After columns are added, you can add rows. The rows can be named whatever you like, however use an appropriate name in this module.<n><n>### Part4: Loop through questions and get results<n> while(rs.next()){<n> 	String question = rs.getString(0);<n>	String answer = rs.getString(1);<n>	String prob = rs.getString(2);<n>	String pros = rs.getString(3);<n>	String cons = rs.getString(4);<n>	String exp = rs.getString(5);<n>	for(int i=1;i<=4;i++){<n>	String response = "\"Your answer to \"\" "+question +" - \"\" \"\" "+answer +"\"\" Is Correct!\"";<n>    pf.println(response);<n>	}<n> }<n> System.exit(0);<n>}<n>catch(Exception e){<n>	System.err.println("Problem!");<n>}<n>}<n>

Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Traveling underwater has many dangers, such as low visibility causing what? Choices:  A: disorientation B: due to C: meeting new people D: getting somewhere E: relocation<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>1. The only answer choice that could be used is D: getting somewhere. The other answers are not possible to travel "underwater".<n>2. The only answer choice which is possible is C: due to. Although it would not be a good idea to travel underwater, one of the things you have to deal with is "low visibility causing disorientation".<n>3. It seems like the student would need more intelligence so more brains would help.<n>4. Although, the cat was wild, he could still be read for some nap. "Tuna fish" is an unrelated word that will probably give more misconception if it's in the answer choice.<n>5. Disorientation occurs when one is not able to find a destination.<n><n>### Input<n><n>What will you do when you are promoted to manager?<n><n>### Response<n><n>What I must do when I become promoted to manager would be to train my employees in proper way, assign the best employee to most difficult task, make sure they have a good work-life balance, motivate the workforce based on the interest, be able to delegate more work, and provide an environment of trust in the workplace.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? A: A new, better car, a new job, being promoted, going to new conferences and getting a better salary. B, D E. He would like those jobs, but didn't have a way of getting them.]<n><n>Answers:<n>1: His answer was "getting a promotion."<n>2: He was excited at the thought of getting a new position.<n>3: But he worried about having enough of a salary to pay more rent & have more travel expenses.<n>4: He worried about having to meet a lot of new people.<n>5: And he worried about managing 15 employees to keep people from leaving.<n>6: And he worried that he might have to change cities.<n>7: In his fantasy his responsibilities were to do the paperwork he loathed.<n>8: He thought about a nice office that was quiet but he couldn't afford to get such a nice place so he wasn't worried about how the new office would be.<n>9: If he had a new job with a lot more salary he would be happy, he loved the challenge of getting more pay, but worried about not being as happy as he'd imagined he'd be with the job.<n>10: He would love the status of being a supervisor but he worried about always having to be on the phone.<n>11: He worried that he'd have to keep up with his new workers.<n>12:  He worried about having trouble remembering all the things he used to like from his old job.<n><n>### Input][Jan wasn't very good in school. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:What might a person receive from their boss if they do a poor job? Choices:  A: misfortune B: fearful C: criticism D: make mistakes E: promotion appraisal<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>I always think of a job as being an opportunity to be successful, and it is up to me how much I want to succeed with the position. There are multiple ways to get to where I want to be, but some are more comfortable and easier than others.<n><n>### Input B<n><n>A man dreamed about getting a new car on the way to meet his boss. The boss asked the mend questions and he answered them well. He asked for a promotion and the boss gave it to him.<n><n>### Demo_1:<n><n>The new car might put him under pressure, but it could be a good thing since pressure can lead to success. The man has the same job though, but it is just easier to get to where he wants to be. He probably has more responsibility and benefits as well.<n><n>### Response_1:<n><n>I personally have never dreamed about getting a promotion, but I probably would like to. I have never fantasied about getting anything else, not because of how poorly it would do, but maybe instead because I know that I have what it takes to make it to the top. I know that working at my job I could achieve the promotion and have more fun than anything else.<n><n>### Question for help:<n><n>1. Write a line to tell us where you found the question.<n>2. He might be a success and have more responsibilites.<n><n>### Quetion:<n>Write a question that asks information.<n><n>## Response:<n><n>A: What did the man do to help a friend solve a problem?<n>B: What is the story about?<n>C: How is the man feeling inside
