Choices: 0: meat 1: carrots 2: chocolate 3: bread 4: grits 5: eggs<n><n>Input: He spent an average of 40 hours a week reading but he was a what, a doctor in 1700s?Choices: 1: law 2: doctor 3: artist 4: poet 5: singer<n><n>Input: It takes time to build a fire and burn it in your yard, what do you do in the meantime? Choices: 2: wait 3: wait a long time 4: think 5: talk to others 6: sleep<n><n>### 3.Write a response that appropriately does the things below:<n>* Answer the question as though the question were a conversation you were part of. Write an appropriate response.<n><n>* Make an observation to draw the listener's attention to a specific point.<n>* State the main idea(s) or the purpose the listener should remember.<n><n>The above questions have at least three choices you can answer. In my example for "What about that guy," I have 5 choices, so you get how to answer those. The questions have 3 choices, so the answers must be a, b, and c. In all these questions the speaker is telling you something important, so you should choose these answers and write in a response that appropriately answers the questions. All answers are words!<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:A lonely man committed suicide, why would he do that? Choices:  A: suffering B: he was happy C: avoid problems D: unhappy E: end pain<n><n>### Response:		What you describe, are all that describe why a person might kill themselves other than the obvious: they are not happy or they suffer from some kind of affliction.<n><n>### Example:Avoid the problems<n><n><n>### Task:<n>Describe a task in a programming language that can execute within less than twenty seconds.<n><n>Input: This program generates the sum of all the even integers for an argument.<n><n>Example:The even numbers of 4 generates the following sum.  4^2+6^2+8^2, and so on.<n><n>### Response must only contain the executable code that answers the following question succinctly.<n><n>### Answering how long it will take for it to execute.<n><n>### Using this code as an example and making changes to the code.<n><n><n>**Function 1 - This program determines if a value is even**<n><n>```<n>    num = int(input("Please input number to check "))   <n>    if num%2 == 0:<n>    return True<n>    <n>        else:<n>    return False<n>```<n><n>**Function 2 - This program calculates the 1st n^2** <n><n>```<n>    i = int(input("Enter value for n: ")) <n>    p = i*i <n>    while i <=1000:       <n>    p = p + i <n>    i = i +1 <n>    print (p)   <n>```<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Having a car in the city seemed to be more trouble than it was worth, the man still had to walk to and from the what after commuting? Choices:  A: driveway B: the event C: scrap heap D: parking garage E: repair shop<n><n>### Response:		D: parking garage<n><n>### Input:[She was studying the history of Egypt. Which of these is not something ancient Egypt had?] Choices:  A, B, C, D, and E<n><n>1. Were used to wipe their faces.<n>2. Used toilets.<n>3. Were used for money.<n>4. Had phones.<n>5. Were used for currency.<n>6. Wearing clothes.<n><n>### Answer:<n>1.Were used to wipe thier faces<n>2.Used toilets.

What are the students going to do first? Choices: <n>- 1st: decide on how to present an animal<n>- 2nd: draw themselves as an animal<n>- 3rd: learn everything they can about an animal<n>- 4th: interview a zookeeper or animal specialist<n>- 5th: work with their group to design a final draft for a project<n>Demonstration and Instruction<n>What should be a group project should instead be a class exercise. All group work is a waste of time, so that what is not needed.<n>Whether or not a project is a group effort can have a major effect on which students do the work and how well it is performed. Group projects often lead to students doing none of the work.  <n>Answer: 2nd: draw yourself as an animal<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Many containers full of goods are unloaded where after their long sea journey Choices:  A: port B: cargo ship C: refrigerator D: food E: lorry<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple questions.<n><n>### Response Body:<n>#### How does he feel about his friends who he will not be able to have a long term friendship with and how is having it easier than having it harder for him?<n>"He was good at traditional science, but excelled at social sciences. His favorite subject was history." I think he's sad and is not looking forward to never seeing them again. It is easier for him since it will be one way. If they go somewhere, it will be a bittersweet moment when he sees them since he won't be able to stay and talk with them.<n><n>#### What two groups of people are they in now and why?<n><n>The two groups they are in now are children and teens. She didn’t understand things very quickly and they are slow to learn and grow. They are smaller than adults, but they have a sense for curiosity and that is how they learn.

Choices:  A: graph B: bank at noon C: good book D: post office E: bus stop<n><n>### Response:		The response should be written in Java and have two methods <n>- 1. A line up method with overloaded methods (a method for each choice) that does the following: <n>    - Decrements the int index from +1 and prints a capital letter.<n>    - If the index is smaller than 0 and the line array is not null, add to the end of the line.<n>    - The line array if it is not null needs to be converted to a String.<n>    - Repeat these steps until the end of the array is reached or the index is no longer negative, whichever comes first, and the lineArray contains no strings. <n><n>- 2.  A sort method that does the following:<n>    - Reverses the order of the line with no parameters. <n>    - Reversing requires two elements.<n>    - Adds the indices of the elements to array.<n>    - Removes the elements from the line. <n>    - Adds a null index in the line.<n>    This requires an overloaded method for each option chosen.  <n>   - In both methods, the method should not use the index parameter but rather only the element parameter.<n><n>### Input2: If there is a string called a coin stack, create a method that would print the words "one, two, three" for the top 3 coins in the coin stack (a stack that can contain multiple denominations of the same value like pennies and dimes so multiple 1 coins exists and the stack may be empty. In other words, this method is being asked to print what is in the stack if it is a 3 coin stack of any denomination.  <n><n>### Output: The stack is 3 quarters and 2 dimes so the output should be "one, two,3"<n><n>### Input3: If there is a 4 element array of objects called a class called a queue  in Java then create a method called front <n>  that will  return the object at the front of the queue if there is an object there  and null if no object is present.<n><n>### Output1: The queue is 25, 15, 11, 10 and the front function would return 25.<n>  <n>### Output2: The queue is 5, 3 and 2 and the front

Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Where is a good place to sore a wind instrument in you home? Choices:  A: under bed B: symphony C: music room D: band practice E: music store<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>### Output:<n>This is my suggestion or answer for the question you asked. <n><n>### Expected Result:<n><n><n>## The following text are examples of my writing.<n><n>### Excerpt 1<n>How do you play the wind instruments?  It was a fun day at the music store when we saw all the different instruments we could buy.<n><n>### The wind instruments are:  what, choirs, orchestra and opera.<n><n>### I liked best the horn and tuba and didn't get all of the other instruments the way they worked.<n><n>### We had a lot of fun that day.<n><n>### By,<n><n>Mindy<n><n>### Explanation of my writing:<n><n>In the excerpt above, I write about how to play different instruments.  <n><n>### Grammatical and stylistic correctness:<n><n>In the above excerpt, I wrote my best to write correctly.  I have some trouble because I am from a different country that speaks English as a Second Language.  I made sure that  I put quotations marks on the band instruments and used the correct word tuba versus tupperware.<n><n>### Spelling :<n><n>In the above examples, I write with a lot of misspellings.  What I like more is to use the thesaurus to find the right word to  use.<n><n>### Clarity:<n><n>In above excerpt,  I used the clarity.  This means to put a lot of words and pictures into sentences so that you get a  better understanding of what I mean by my ideas.<n><n>### ELO:<n><n>In the examples above, I write ELO.  This means,  what was important in what I wrote.<n><n>### Coherence:<n><n>I like write coherent.  This means to be clear about my ideas.<n><n>The best is to think of the topic I wish to write about and write a list of words I want to use.<n><n>## To create a new writing project...<n><n>### Go to the following URL and click on the "create a new project" link<n><n>https://github.com/vitaly-t/Vita-Projects-Writing/tree/feature/vita<n><n>### Make a branch from

Choices:  A: new york B: big city C: town D: idaho E: shopping mall<n><n>### Response:		It is located in idaho because big city is not correct because it is not a city.<n><n>### Extension:<n>1. Expand the example to a two paragraph essay.<n>2. Expand the Instruction to a question that can be answered by a complete essay response (multiple paragraph response) that includes<n>  - a lead statement,<n>  - topic sentences, and<n>  - evidence from the text.<n>3. Expand the example by adding or moving words or phrases around.<n><n>### Key points<n>1. An answer will be complete if it addresses all aspects of the topic.<n>2. An answer will be correct if it is accurate and includes specific details from the text.<n><n>### Directional Guides<n>1. An answer can take the form of a statement, question, or sentence.<n>2. A good answer can be the same length as the question.<n>3. An answer can include direct quotes, indirect quotes, paraphrases, or summaries.<n>4. A good answer can include a lead and related evidence from the text.

Where might she live? Choices:  A: food court B: jerusalem C: new york city D: jewish community E: town<n><n>### Response:		<n>Lilly probably lives in a religiously populated area. She doesn't live in a heavily populated area because no delis are close to her town. Also, she doesn't live far from a jewish community because there are none. Kosher delis serve a smaller number of customers so her living in a more populated area would not be good for her business.<n><n>### Input 2:If your employer had the ability to hire an unlimited number of employees at the cost of $10,000, how many employees would they pay for?  What additional information would help them make a decision? Choices:  None  Choose one:<n><n>### Demnstration:<n>Employers hire based on quality not quantity. The only additional information needed is the pay per worker.<n><n>### Response 2:<n><n>It is not smart to hire unlimited people since the number of workers will be infinite. <n>If the employers could only hire 4 more people then, the employers would need to have the money paid for the 4 workers which is 80k<n><n>### Input3:<n>What is a quality that makes you stand out? Your response should follow in the same vein.<n><n>### Solution:<n><br>The lady continued on with her journey.  She noticed that the landscape had changed.  There were huge trees that seemed to hold up the sky.  She was amazed at how tall the trees were!  She wondered how she should tell people about what she had seen.  The group decided that it was best to get as far off the trail as they could to get a good view of the mountains.  They decided at this point that the journey was far from over.  The lady began to wonder if she had the skills necessary to make it

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Where was the apple tree said to contain something forbidden? Choices:  A: north carolina B: washington state C: nil D: great outdoors E: garden of eden<n><n>### Response:		D: Eden<n><n>### Explanation <n>* I looked at the first line and went to the index of "Where was..."  and found the answer<n>* Because there is "was" at the beginning of the sentence, I figured that it would be something in the past or something long ago. I also knew that it couldn't be somewhere in South Carolina, though.<n>* When I looked to where was the apple tree said... it said Eden, and that is what I found.<n><n>### Solution:<n>You can't always find the answer you want. The first line in the instructions tells you what kind of answer you should give. If you don't find it, try and figure out what they are asking for instead.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Where could you find multiple ruler that are owned by different people? Choices:  A: measure distance B: england C: office D: drawer E: desk<n><n>### Response:		A ruler is different from another, thus only one ruler is for every person or set. So the answer will be B.<n><n>### Response 2:<n><n>I agree with this response, it is different from other response, so the answer will be B<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>This task follows a multiple choice format, with choices "B" and "F" being incorrect. Therefore, these cannot<n>be used as the correct answer.<n><n>I think if it was a single choice format you could make the argument that either one could be correct<n>since one is true (the correct answer) and the other is not.<n><n>But if it is a multiple choice format then it is clear what the correct answer should be, so there is no question<n>that "B" should not be accepted as a correct answer.<n><n>### My Response:<n><n>Input: What is a ruler? Choices: 1: It is one meter, two meters, or some other value. 2:  It is also used to keep track of temperature.  These are the same thing. No answer means: 1. it is used to measure distance 2. Someone will give you the answer.<n><n>## Question 2:<n><n>The correct answer must be "A" since that is the correct answer.<n>I chose the other responses just as a "what if" of what would happen if I chose the other responses.<n><n><n>Instructions:<n><n><n>## Question 3:<n><n>The response below is written by someone who is unclear on the instructions, but understands the task.<n><n>**Response 1**<n><n>## Question 4:<n><n>Response 1, has it all, and the only thing left in this world!<n><n>Instructions<n><n>Write the answer on this page.

Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Which region has the most famous temple? Choices:  A: jerusalem B: jewish community C: middle east D: city E: mosque<n><n>### Response:		<n>The temple in Jerusalem is probably the best known.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>* The answer I came up with was the Jerusalem Temple, where Jesus is suppose to have appeared after his death and resurrection.<n><n>### Input(different):Which region has the busiest subway system? Choices: <n>A: Paris B: Berlin C: London D: New York E: Washington DC<n><n>### Response(different)<n>The New York Subway is probably the busiest. If Paris is a part of this selection, I would change my answer from New York to Paris.<n><n>### Justification:<n>The main reason I came up with the New York busiest subway system is because of the size and the fact that Paris has the Metro and not the Subway. New York has the subway and the New York subway system moves over 1 billion people a year, Paris has the metro, which was used by 499,385,123 people in 2010.<n><n>### Task:<n>The main reason for doing this task was a way to learn how to do a task that can help me if I decided to take the AP test for English. The format is very similar to the questions I would get on the test.<n>

Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:East coast areas such as Florida are found where? Choices:  A: florida B: denmark C: united states D: map E: california<n><n>### Response:		<n>The response will match the task and include 6 of the following:<n>### 1. If the task requests a 6-element list, write: (1 and 6) a) {1, 2, 3, 5}<n>      b) (1, 2, (5, 6)<n>    <n>### 2. If the task requests to write an expression, write: (1) a) (2) - (3) + (4)<n>      b) -3 - (7) / 3 = 2 - (5)/3 = 2 - 6 - 5 = -1 b) if the task requests a conditional response<n>      c) if (a) -b; then a / b = 1; else<n>      d) else (b * c) e) if otherwise (2) then (3) else (4)<n><n>Note: if (a) = (5) then 5 = b; else<n>### 3. If the task requests an array of numbers with an integer range, write: (2 + 3 + 4) (1)<n>     <n>### 4. If the task requests: a) if (a) then b); else c), write:<n>### 5. If the task requests (4 + 8) a * (3<n>      b) for (1; 5; 2), write: for (1<n>      ( (10+19)/0; )<n>      /(1+0); (19+10)/0;<n>      (10+10+10);<n>      /1;<n>      (1+)<n><n>### 6. If the task requests write (a) while (b) then write something)<n> <n>### 7. If the task asks to write something between ',' write (1, 2, 3) using a ;<n>     <n>### Note: if the above code does not match the task, try another one.

Or you could throw it when the river is low. <n><n>### Input<n>Input the following code to draw a square. Then use the square as a reference point to draw a circle and a line (connecting dots.)<n><n>## Instructions<n><n>Initiate a project to explore the number of steps needed to write code to draw a square and a circle. Write the code in the form of the project, as it will be presented. Code will be written in Ruby. <n><n>## Demonstration<n>What does an object do? For this activity you will be using the square and the circle objects created in lesson six. Create methods to draw these shapes.<n>## Instructions <n>Initiate a class for square and circle based on the squareshape class from lesson 6. Include an initialize method that creates both the square and circle objects. Include a color method that takes a color string and a fill method that takes a fill string and draws the shape. <n>Create a new window containing a square and circle instance and a green rectangle instance. Invoke fill, fillcolor and draw methods on the objects.<n>## Demonstrations<n>Draw a square. Invoke the color method with the color string “red”.<n>Draw a circle. Invoke the colormethod. with the color string “green”.<n>Draw a rectangle. Invoke the fillcolor method with the string“black”.<n>Display the output on a new window.<n>## Instruations<n>Create the methods for the object that takes a string as an argument to draw a line. Include a new method in the object and name it “stem”. (This will be used to draw the stem in the rectangle). Then, draw a line to the rectangle and name the lines stem line. Include a draw  method that takes the stems parameter, an optional color and draws the line. Invoke the color and draw methods. <n>Display the output on the new window using the red rectangle that you created in the previous instruction and demonstration.<n>## Instruactions<n>In this activity you will code methods that draw a rectangle and rectangle subdivisions. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:What is the hope of playing sports without competition? Choices:  A: running B: have fun C: balls touch D: winning E: get tired<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The hope of playing sports without comp is to have fun.<n><n>### 2<n><n>### What is the difference in the use of a and an when they are used before words that don't start with a vowel sound? <n><n>When there is a word that starts with a vowel sound the a is used before words like the following. when there is no or little vowel sound before the words, the an is used.<n>```<n>A: aardvark A: apple<n>an: analogy an: ambulance<n>an: anarchy an: analysis<n>```<n><n>### What determines which form is used and when?<n><n>There are two rules, 1:  It will depend if the first letter in the word is lower-case or not, the second rule: It will depend on how the word sounds.<n><n>### Choose the correct answers for the following exercises.<n><n>####1. What does the word "the" do in this sentence? Choices: A: describes the verb B: starts a new sentence C: is not correct D: does not do anything<n>Answer: A: describes the subject B: is not correct<n><n>####2. What is the word "them" doing in this sentence? Choice: A: the subject of the sentence B: a pronoun C: the verb D: not doing anything<n>Answer A: the subject of this sentence.<n><n>####3. Can you change this sentence without changing its meaning? Choices:  A. She is getting up, too. B: She is getting up like me. C: She is getting up for me.<n>Answer: C. She is getting up for you.

Choices:  A: open meadow B: arctic tundra C: beach D: great outdoors E: england<n><n>### Response:		D:great outdoors<n><n>### Input2: Why is your boss angry at your mistake?<n><n>### Response 2:My boss has been angry at this mistake before.This mistake must have happened before.<n><n>### Input3: Why do you think the boss is still angry?<n><n>### Respose 3: The boss is still angry because of your past mistake.

Choices:  A: upside down B: in motion C: active D: wakefulness E: resthold<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Solution description:<n><n><details><n><summary><strong>Solution A)</strong></summary><n><n>**Instructions:** Whenever you can, use the given input to make a complete sentence.<n><n>**Input (A):** James's bouncing was at rest, he could sleep, but he would not wake up in the morning in the rubber balls, and then put them active.<n><n>**Response (A):** James slept because his bouncing rubber ball was at rest.  He never woke up because he put the bouncing rubber sphere in motion.<n><n></details><n><n><details>  <summary><strong>Soluton B)</strong></summary></details><n><n><br><n><n><details><summary><n>    Solution B:<n>  <n></summary><n><n>**Input (B):** He could sleep.  <n>He would get up in the rest (morning) again.<n><n>**Response (**):** James can sleep and he put his bouncing rubbersphere again.<n><n></details></br><n> <n>**Instructions**: Whenever you can, write a sentence beginning the given sentence that ends at a full stop.<n><n>**Input:** I was very careful not to wake her when I shook her up.<n><n>**Response:** I was very. I was not careful. I did not want her to wake up when I was shaking the rubber.<n><n>**Instruments:** <n><n><details> <summary> **Solution C)** <strong></strong></summary> </details><n><n><figcaption><n>    <strong>Solution C:</strong><n>  </figcaption><n><n>**Input: He didn't want to wake her up.**He decided not to shake up her**.<n><n>**Response**: He was not careful because he was not making her wake up<n><n>**Instrucions:** <n><details><n>Whenever you can, write another sentence that begins with the same sentence and ends, or uses an equal amount of characters.<n><n>**Input**: I was careful not to wake him up.<n><n>**Rresponse:** I was careful.<n></details><n> <n><n><details><strong><n>Solution D)

"He is correct that they love to eat flowers."<n><n><n><n>### Challenge:<n>Write a recursive pseudocode for a function that will test for a number ending with a zero and add an appropriate number of zeros. The function should take two parameters: 1. the number to test and 2. the number of zeros to add. In the test example 1 below, the 89612 needs to be tested. The function will return a 89610.<n><n>### Testing:<n><n>Input for the first input parameter: 17.<n><n>Input for the second input parameter: 0.<n><n>Expected output: "170."<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>1. If the number is divisible by two<n>2. then add 1<n>3. else<n>4. continue<n><n>```python<n>def add_zeros(x:int, y:int):<n>    if x % 2 == 0:<n>        print(x, x / y)<n>    else:<n>        return x<n>```

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:What could you put a table in if you want the table to be in your house? Choices:  A: library B: demonstration C: corner D: football ground E: rug<n><n>### Response:		<n>I can put a table in my living room, my library, or my corner.<n><n>### Input is an instruction that asks you to perform a task and describe the task.<n><n>- What: A statement of what you must do.<n>- How: A statement describing what to do.<n>- Who: An optional statement about who to do it.<n>- Where: An optional statement about where to do it.<n><n>```<n>function doSomething()<n>{<n>  who => "I"<n>  where => "the living room"<n>  what => "table"<n>  how => "{ 2+2;  }"<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Demo<n><n>```javascript<n>doSomething(who="I"; what="table"; where="the living room");<n>```<n><n>## Output<n><n>The output describes the requested task and what the result is.<n><n>### Demo Output<n><n>```javascript<n>{<n>  who="I",<n>  what="table",<n>  where="the living room",<n>  how = { 2+2; }<n>}<n>```<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:What do only some types of police do? Choices:  A: direct traffic B: board vessels C: arm themselves D: help people E: find drugs<n><n>### Response:		What do police officers do?<n>This is not an appropriate answer choice to pick.<n>You need to either give an example of police work or refer to the general nature of a police officer. In this example, you can't just refer to "police".<n><n>You can refer to any specific type of police work, but police officer in General are generally responsible for the following -<n><n>1. keeping the peace<n>2. Preventing law-breaking<n>3. enforcing laws<n>4. arresting suspected criminals<n><n>You can also refer to common police activities – for example,<n><n>1. directing traffic<n>2. responding to emergency calls<n>3. investigating accidents<n>4. directing traffic<n>5. giving first aid.<n><n>Answer: A: direct traffic<n><n>Input: He made the most out of a what that didn't fit in his closet. Choices: A: shelf B: garage C: window D: shack E: suitcase<n><n>Answer: D: suitcase<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Complete the task of describing a task that involves the answer to a series of questions.<n><n>### Task:<n><n>Give a response to the prompt. You are to respond to the prompts by selecting the choice that best completes the task.<n><n>### Notes:<n>Each prompt should start and end with the same text other prompts of the same type, even if they have a different answer, should be unique.<n><n>#### For each question, the answer is contained within the question itself.<n><n>### Example:<n><n>Input: I am looking for my lost watch. I'd ask the man on the corner if he had it, I forgot his name. Choices: A) What's the man's name? B) How do I meet him? C) What is his name?D) How does the man meet me? E) How do I find my watch if he has my watch.<n><n>Answer: B) How do I mee<n><n>####<n><n>### Feedback:<n><n>If you are looking for feedback, let's [connect on GitHub](https://ghostbin.com/auth/signin).<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Some might say that if you want to do something that results in changing society then you need to start from within, to do this what would you be doing? Choices:  A: riots B: vote C: change yourself D: social activism E: change clothes<n><n>### Response:		I would change myself with hard work and dedication. I would practice the things required for being a better citizen, a respectful partner & husband, and a productive worker. As I change myself, I would also take on social issues in the public arena. As I change, I believe that a bigger change would take place within me, which would change me for the better.<n><n>### Input2: How might you change yourself?<n><n>Response: As I think about myself, I realize that change is necessary at every stage of life. If I want to be successful in life, then I have to change with each new development, each change in technology and new developments within myself. I can't stay stuck on old ideas, in the hopes that they would work out for me. What I have to do is to learn new skills, think outside the box and try to understand life for what it is. Then I will have a change in me that will be the catalyst for a positive change within myself and thus a change in the world around me. Changes have to be made if we are to grow individually and collectively. If changes are not made and positive development doesn't take place, then the status quo will take over and there will be no advancements in culture, science, or technological development. We have to be willing to have change and move forward, otherwise change will have us and we won't be able to keep up.<n><n>### How was it?<n>* [Getting Started](https://exercism.io/tracks/python3-fuzz/exercises/getting-started)<n>* [Getting Help 📱](https://get.help.exercism.io)<n>* [GitHub Issues 💬](https://github.com/exercism/python3_fuzz/issues)<n>* [Stack Overflow ✨](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/exercism)<n>* [Discussions 🗣️](https://github.basecamphq.com/exercisms/python3_futz-exercises/discussions)<n>* [About Contributing 💻](https://github.io/exercism/docs/technical.html)<n><n>### Further Resources<n>* [Educ

Choices:  A: mountain dew B: glass C: soft drink D: whirlpool bath E: coffee cup<n><n>### Response:		Soft drink<n><n>What is wrong with this response?<n><n>Soft drink is not an ingredient in any sugary beverage. <n><n>### Solution:<n>The statement is a generalization, which makes it false. There are many examples of soft drinks which include ingredients other than water. I've also added some spaces to make the response more readable, I've used spaces instead of commas.<n><n>### What to do next:<n>Next up is logic.

Choices:  A: board ship B: shout at C: smile at D: cross street E: feel happy<n><n>### Response:		<n><p align="justify">Sir/Mam/ma'am<br><n><n>How can you get theattention of a person across the road,<n><n>- board ship<br><n>- shout at<br><n>- smile at<br><n>or<br><n>- cross streets<br><n>- feeling happy<n>The correct answer is smile at.<n> <n>### Instruction answer:<n>- Smile<n>- Shouting<n>- Cross Streets<n>- Four Legs<n>- Tuna Fish<n>- Feel happy<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Where could you find many theater? Choices:  A: school B: populated area C: military base D: opera E: church<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### A: school<n><n>* School has an educational system and it helps a student become smarter and develops their mind.<n>* It is a place where a student gets taught and learn different skills which can be helpful in further life.<n>* It also teaches a student about how to be good in life and develop in every way.<n><n>### B: populated area<n><n>* A populated area is a place where many people can be found.<n>* This is a place which is located between different cities and a populated area is usually the city.<n>* In such areas, one can see many activities in the area and also, there are very cheap restaurants.<n><n>### C: military base<n><n>* It is an area which is completely covered by trees and all types of animals.<n>* Some animals are very dangerous to be around you and can be very harmful.<n>* It is also a place for the military to survive in the tough times with the enemy.<n><n>### D: opera<n><n>* The opera was formed to take inspiration from the plays and other acts.<n>* There are many types of the opera but one is the most famous Opera in Vienna.<n>* It is different for the other art and for one opera as well it had many tunes.<n><n>### E: church

Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:What  might john order at an indian resturant on top of the space needle? Choices:  A: large city B: seattle C: curry D: clothing E: reservation<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>He might order the clothing <n>```<n><n>### Inputs:He likes to go to resturants and drink wine. Choices:  a. a large city b. seattle c. curry d. clothing e. reservation<n><n>## Response:<n>```<n>b and c <n>```<n><n># Programs<n>```<n>Program: main.c<n><n>#include <stdio.h><n>int main(void) //This says to run only main with no other files<n>{<n>    printf("hello,world\n");<n>    return 0;<n>}<n>```<n><n>```<n>Program: hello.c<n><n>//This file is main.c's hello.c and contains only the main function. <n>#include <stdio-h><n>int main()<n>{<n>    printf("%s", "hello world\n");<n>    system("date -s \"mon 1 1+10 s\"");<n>    return 1;<n>}<n>```

Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: medicine cabinet B: medicine chest C: armpits D: grocery store E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		To help me out, I am going to need to know my body type.  We would prefer you to know it.  You can choose from three choices:  A: apple B: pear C: rectangle D: spider<n><n>### Input :He hated the smell of the but if he tried to put on what while brushing his teeth and the pros and cons for that and the but? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:The clothing was extremely expensive compared to other places, where was it likely purchased? Choices:  A: cinema hall B: mall C: department store D: closet E: shop<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>I think store C because of the price difference.<n><n>```<n>// This is where the code would go<n>@if (Session::has('message'))<n><div class="alert alert-success"><n>   {{ Session::get('message') }}<n></div><n>@endif<n>```

Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Where is a snake likely to reside? Choices:  A: tropics B: nightmare C: wyoming D: bushes E: feild<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**In the answer choices**<n><n>* C = snake could reside in wyoming<n>* D = snake could resides in feild<n><n>**In the actual question**<n><n>* The question reads:**"Where is a snake likely to reside?"**<n>* The answer choices read:**"tropics, nightmare, wyoming, bushes, feild"**<n><n>### Input<n>The dog enjoyed a short walk early in the morning before work. After work he liked to go for a what?<n>### Response<n><n>**In the question**<n><n>* Early in the morning is in the morning<n><n>**In the multiple choice**<n><n>* The right answer is:<n>> walk **at night**<n><n>The question reads:<n><n>* **The dog enjoyed a short **Walk **at night before work. After work, he often went for another walk**.**<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>What is the question for?<n><n>* In the question read "Which of the following is true of echolocation?"<n>* In the question choices read "echo location, ultrasound, or ranging"<n><n>### Demostration<n><n>Input: Which of the following statements concerning echolocation can be inferred from the paragraph above? Choice:	A:  Only bats can hear the ranging of sound. B:  All species that have echolocation also rely on other senses. C:  Both bats and toothed whales can hear the ranging. D:  Bats are not as well adapted for echolocation as dolphins. E:  Both bats' and toothed whale's hearing can give them information about the distance and size of what they detect.<n>Answer:	D:  Both bats are not as well are adapted for echolocations as dolphins.<n><n>### Problem<n>What is the problem in this reading passage?<n><n>* The reading passage has a paragraph and a multiple choice test.**<n>* The problems reads: **"Which of the following can help you find a safe place to go if the water reaches your house? Choice:  A: Wiggle your toes to test for the texture of the floor. B: Put on your wet suit and begin to swim away.

Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Traders work on the floor of the stock what? Choices:  A: building B: hallway C: table D: exchange E: office<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Traders work on the trading floor on the stock exchange.<n>###### The best answer is E: office.<n>###### The worst answer is B: hallway<n><n>###### If I have made an error, please point it out and I will correct it.<n><n>---<n>©2012-2022 [Michael J. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Remembering past successe is likely to cause what? Choices:  A: problems B: crying C: inspiration D: trauma E: nightmares<n><n>### Response:		Answers can be found in text.<n>

Choices:  T: running B: swimming C: walking D: biking E: jogging<n><n>### Response T: walking<n><n>### Demands:If a friend is walking with me, how would I adjust my pace? Choices:  I: we will both go faster T: slower than I B: I'll go slower than him C: I'll stay the same pace as I D: he will go faster than I E: I will go faster than him<n><n>### Response I: I will go slower as he is walking faster<n><n>### Responses to request:<n>Response: He had what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Dan outfitted his house to run on the oldest heat source on Earth. What is the oldest heat source on Earth? Choices:  A: fire B: solar energy C: sun D: house E: coal or wood<n><n>### Response:		Dan outfitted his house for solar energy<n><n>### Input He was in a car accident. What part of the body was in the worst shape? Choices: <n>A: head B: stomach C: abdomen D: wrist E: finger<n><n>### Response Head (wrist)<n><n>### Input They started in a room full of gifts but didn't take them all the presents. Which of these are they missing? Choose all that apply (Bonus Question). Choices:  A. 98 B. 109 C. 99 D. 108<n><n>### Response They are missing A. 98, D. 1013<n><n>### Input She had a large lizard. What was the name of this lizard? Choices:  (Bonus Question) A: Shiatsu B: Lego Man C: Snoozie D: Snoopy E: Snoop Dogg<n><n>### Response Lizard<n><n>### Input People usually eat in a few places when visiting a city. (Bonus Question:What kinds of establishments are they usually eating in? How to Relax or What is Relax<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>### Input<n>1. What do cats like best?<n>2. A good book<n>5. What is relaxing and how to study better<n><n><n>### Response<n>1. What animals are most dangerous? Dogs, cats, and snakes.<n>2. What is relaxing? Having another cup of coffee and reading a good book<n>3. How to study better? Eat an apple, take a break every 15 minutes, and have someone walk by your shoulder and talk to you.<n><n><n>### Reference:<n><n>https://www.accenture.com/us-en/content/dam/accenture-com/articles/what-is-cognitive-automation-in-business.pdf<n><n>https://www2.ed.gov/parents/academic/help/kindergartners/math_science.pdf<n><n>https:www.khanacademy.org/science/biology<n><n>http://www.microbe-world.net/biology/micro-biology-study.pdf<n><n>https:/www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5121906/pdf/bq299.pdf

Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:If clothes have developed a smell and can't be washed what should you do with them? Choices:  A: hang in closet B: sniff C: get dirty D: become soiled E: air out<n><n>### Response:		<n>I agree the cat should be put in the closet.<n>### Why:<n>* A:  Avoid smell<n><n>### Input What else can be done?<n>* C:  Sniff them<n>* D:  Soiled<n>* A:  Air out the clothes<n><n>### Response<n>We can put the smelly clothes in the freezer to deodorize them.<n>### Why<n>#### Airing out<n>* Clothes are left out in the open air so they can get a smell of a fresh breeze.<n>#### Putting the smelly clothes in a freezer<n>* When the clothes are put in the freezer, the moisture in the clothes will turn to ice or water vapor. The evaporating water or ice breaks down the organic matter or the smell.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:The accelerator was controller via a hand throttle, and the foot pedals controlled the steering in the small what? Choices:  A: car B: fuel system C: accelerate D: boat E: airplane<n><n>### Response:		<n>```python<n>def Answer(input, demonstration):<n>   input = input()<n>   demonstration = demonstration()<n>   if input == demonstration:<n>   return "Correct!"<n>if input!= demonstration:<n>   if demonstration == A:<n>   return "Incorrect, please try again."<n>if demonstration == B:<n>   if input == C:<n>   return "True!"<n>   else:<n>   return "No, it depends on who is doing it!"<n> if demonstration == C:<n>   if input  ==D:<n>   return "Try again!"<n>if input  ==D: <n>   if input == E:<n>   return "That is good, it is one of his favourites!"<n>if input == E:  <n>   return "Good, cats must take naps!"<n>else: <n>   return "Incorect!"<n>```<n><n>### Response 2<n>```<n>import random<n><n>def Answer(input):<n>   print("Your Question:" +input)<n>   myquestionlist= ['1.New car','2.A promotion','3.Boredom','4.Impatience','5.Pressure','6.A new car','7.History','8.more intelligence','9.stealing','10.food','11.Steering','12.food.','13.Driving','14.B.promotion','15.C.Steaming','16.A.Boredom','17.C.Food','18.C.Inspiration','19.C.D.','20.C.D.']<n>   random.shuffle(myquestionlist)<n>    i=random.randrange(0,len(myquestionlist))<n>while input!=myquestionlist[i]:<n>   print ("That is an incorrect answer!")<n>   input=input()<n>   myquestionlist.pop(i)<n><n><n>myq=['New car','promotion','stealing','food','drinking']<n>ans=input('What do you want to drink?')<n>for r in myq:<n>   if r==ans:<n>    print ('Correct answer:')<n>    print (r)<n>   else:<n>    print ('Wrong answer:')<n>    myq.remove(r)<n>```<n>

I like a democracy because you have more of a say in what you are doing.<n><n>### A Republic:<n>America is the land of opportunity.  You have the freedom to build your own life, to pursue what you want to do; your success is up to you.  An elected representative protect your freedoms and your rights.  A republic is a place where the citizens (people) rule.  Republic is a government system that is not under the rule or control of a monarch, dictator, or oligarchy.  A republic is under a constitution.  The main purpose of a republic is to protect individual freedoms and rights and to prevent one person from having power over the whole country.  In essence, in a republic form of government citizens have democratic and republican freedoms.<n><n>### Authoritarianism:<n>An authoritarian style is a top down approach; the focus is centralized on the needs of the leader rather than distributed to those in the lower levels; an individual or group whose behaviour is dictated by a superior, regardless of the consequences for the individual or group.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Where do you buy tickets at a ticket booth for games/ Choices:  A: train station B: cathedral C: metro station D: fairgrounds E: amusement park<n><n>### Response:		At a ticket booth for a game/<n><n>### Discussion:<n>  We write "ticket booth for game" and include the preposition "for" followed by the location to make it clear that we are speaking of a ticket booth located somewhere for the game and not just a ticket booth for any event. (Note: this is not how the original document wrote it, they wrote ticket booth for games.  The difference here is that the original had a preposition, and a comma and it didn't explain about where or for what event the ticket booth was.  This was written correctly.)<n><n>### Output:<n>He was good at traditional science, but he excelled at social<n><n>studies, his favorite subject was history.<n><n>Jan wasn't very good when studying. What might help him study<n><n>better?<n><n>The cat was wild but like-a all others, he was always ready for a catnap.<n><n>Where do you buy tickers for events at games?<n><n>### Problems: <n>* The example questions ask "what" something.  When you have a preposition in your response, you can't have a question mark.<n>* Also note the comma before and after the preposition for-  They are separating a prepositional phrase.<n>* Also note: The example questions have "what", and are not prepositional- they do not end with a preposition.<n><n><n>

Program Design<n>You are asked to program a solution for this instruction. <n><n>- How many days per week are days that week?<n>  - Input: The user enters the first day of the week. (Examples are Monday, Wednesday or Saturday)<n>  - Output: How many days (Monday to Sunday) are days that week.<n>- How many days till the 1st day of the week?<n>  -Input: The user enters the day after the last day of the week.<n>  -Output: How many days (Sunday to Monday) are between these days.<n><n>---<n>## Rationale<n><n>---<n>## Demostration<n><n><n>### Input<n><n><n>Input:<n>"Enter the first day of the Week:"Wednesday<n><n><n>Output:<n>"How many days per week are Wednesday:"3<n><n><n>### Program<n><n>What I like about my code because:<n>- it is simple,<n>- easy to understand,<n>- can be modified easily if the input or output changes<n><n>What I would like to do to improve my code:<n>- Add comments and explanations for what the code does and does not do<n><n>[Demo](https://github.com/Jaymz-N-Jon/CodeReview/blob/main/105/DayOfWeek.zip)<n>

Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:i like to examine different things,why do books the chapters on the back Choices:  A: examine thing B: go somewhere C: knit D: read book E: see particular program<n><n>### Response:		the different chapters on the back<n>### Note you don't have to answer the question above in order to get the correct response (unless it is an "incorrect" question)<n><n>### Additional Examples:<n><n>##### Instruction:What is the best answer?<n><n>What's the best answer?<n>Which of the following best defines “what”?<n>A(n) ___________<n><n>##### Demonstration<n><n>The definition must: (check all that apply)<n><n>- be a phrase.<n>- be in proper English.<n>- be the definition for the “what” question in the sentence.<n><n>Input: What's the best answer, the correct answer is C: What is the best answer? Choices:  C: What is the the best answer. a: a definition is the best answer<n>Answer: C: What is the definition is the best answer.<n><n><n>### Multiple choice questions<n><n>##### Instructions:<n><n>What is the best definition for the word or phrase (in bold) in the sentence?<n><n><n>##### Demostration<n><n>The definition should (check all that apply):<n><n>- be in proper english.<n>- make up a definition for the “what is/what does” phrase in the sentence.<n>- be a complete sentence.<n><n>##### Note:<n><n>- There could only be one definition, so if you get more than one correct, any subsequent ones are incorrect.<n>- If you get the first correct definition, then you can take the correct answer away.<n><n>##### Sample:<n><n>##### Definition Sentence:<n><n>“She was always the last person to finish their homework.”<n><n>##### Explanation:<n><n>The sentence uses the phrase “what is” to mean “Who/what”, which indicates that it needs a definition.<n><n>##### Correction<n><n>a) She was always the last person (is/does) to finish her homework.<n>B) The last person that she is/does to finish their homework is herself.<n><n>##### Expected Answer:<n><n>a) She is always the last person (in a group) to finish their homework.<n><n><n>## Multiple choice questions with alternate responses<n><n>##### Instructin:<n><n>What is a better answer for the question(s) in the sentence

He's good at traditional and social science,<n>3. He's good with traditional and social science and loves social science.<n>4. He is very good at science and social science.<n>5. He's pretty decent at science and social sciences, loves science and he loves social science.

Choices:  A: winning B: entertainment C: happiness D: cheating E: relaxation<n><n>### Response:		<n>Gambling is a good practice if you know how. It can provide you with entertainment, and you also can gain an experience. People play for fun, but the purpose of the game is to win. However, the chance of winning depends on how good the person is at the game, or how much money the person is ready to invest. Winning is not always about the luck factor; it depends on how you approach your gambling activity and whether you can count on your luck or not. You should be prepared to lose some money and expect to have a fun time too.<n>

Choices:  A: toy store B: basement C: school D: rest area E: building<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>1. Choose the best answer.<n><n>For the first question, the correct choice is B: promotion.<n><n>2. Provide an alternative answer or possible solution.<n><n>For the second question, the correct choice are B: history studies.<n><n>3. Compare and contrast alternatives with the request.<n><n>For the third question, the correct choices are D: more intelligence. <n><n>4. Explain why an answer is incorrect.<n><n>For the fourth question, the correct choices is E: nap.<n><n>5. Show how to use the request to solve a problem.<n><n>Lastly, the correct choice for this question is toy store since "What might help him study better?"  What the request suggests is that you search for toys that will benefit your child's studies.<n><n>### Review your response for accuracy, clarity, and concision.<n>Your response should be in its final form.<n><n>### Submit your solution!<n>- Save all your work as a TXT, JPG, DOC/DOCX or PDF.<n>- Name your assignment “First Name Last Name Assignment4.txt, JPG, DOCC, etc.”

Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:Where are a lot of offices in New York? Choices:  A: school building B: skyscraper C: business D: grocery store. E: work<n><n>### Response:		A: school building<n><n>### Task: Answer the following multiple choice question..<n><n>### Input 1: He was really good at traditional science and excelled at social science. He enjoyed his favorite subject which was? Choices: <n><n>### Input :<n>### Answer 1: A: geography<n><n>### Instructions : Write the code to replace the input with a response.<n>### Input :  Where are most of the job offices in New York?<n>### Output : A: work<n><n>## Challenge!<n><n>Write a function that takes a string as input. The function must print the number that shows up the least times. Here's an example:<n>```<n>input = "5dog4cat3pig2rabbit"<n><n>function f(str) {<n>  return str.split("").map(String).toArray().sort((a, b) => a.length < b.length).sort(function (a, b) => b[0] - a[0]);<n>}<n><n>console.log(f("5dog4cat3dogs2cats1chickens"));<n>```<n><n>output: ["1","chickens"]<n><n>Answer: The problem can be solved very easily by splitting the given string into an array of characters and then sorting that array of characters where you will be able to find the array that matches your condition.<n><n>Here's the code for the solution:<n>```<n>function getNumber(str) {<n> return str.split('').sort((a,b)=>a>b?-1:1).join('')}<n>```

Choices:  Choices: A: plastic B: wood C: gold D: steel E: bronze<n><n>Input: He said, "It's all about the _____." Choices:  a) the title of the newspaper  b) an untrue statement  c) a good example  d) an interesting fact<n><n>Input: How did GPS help solve the mystery?<n><n>### Input<n>GPS, which stands for global positioning systems.<n><n>Answer:<n>Six years ago,  a student who called himself Sparks discovered a dead body in the woods outside of a small town. That's when the police investigated and discovered that this boy was 13 years at the time he committed the crime. His method was to  hide the body in the woods and to cover the blood spots with  a lot of dirt around to avoid detection.   The suspect was arrested and found guilty. At that time, he was sentenced to life in jail.  The police never imagined GPS devices which would help them find the crime's exact location. This lead to the suspect  being re-sentenced to 30 years without parole. There has to be a way to find clues and solve a case without having to use GPS systems. They have to keep searching for more clues and evidence that's right in front of them. They have to remember this situation has happened more than once and that GPS does help the police solve cases.

There is one inch from the top of your forhead to each of your ears. At the top center of your head, there is an imaginary line that runs in a straight line to your chin. The name for this imaginary line is what? Choices: A: horizon B: nose C: back D: neck E: forehead F: back<n><n>### A: horizon<n><n>### How far is it from your office to the nearest shopping center? What is the name of the street your office is on? Choices: A, Street is a narrow, paved road often bordered by buildings or concrete and lined on both sides with trees, cars, or buildings. This is the case in nearly every city: only a few towns are laid out on a rectilinear grid pattern.<n><n>### B, Avenue is a major street near a park or recreation area. Avenue may be spelled as avenue, aveenue, avenune, or some other variant. Some streets may be spelled as one word and others may have the word Street in the spelling. A few such examples are Boulevard, Way, Road, and Court, all major streets.<n><n>### C: Travel, A trip involves one or more vehicles transporting passengers or goods from one location to another. Usually, but not always, it involves some form of transport such as trains, airplanes, buses, ships, or automobiles.<n><n>### D: Park<n><n>### E: Journey<n><n>### F: Path<n><n>### Input How do you get your drinking water? Choices:  E  B, A: Water, A: Bottled Water, A: tap water<n><n>### Response  A: tap<n>

Choices:  A: each state B: gettysburg address C: state of union D: each country E: europe<n><n>### Response:		The big speech in the capital would be each states states address because they all have there own president and congress men. I need to correct the sentence, the gettysber is not a capital speech. The gettysberg speech was speech by a president named george washington. The bigget speech is the state of union in the capital. The capital is the states capitol and the bigest speech would be at the capitol in each state. What ever state was speaking a speech in there capitol they would call it the most powerful speech.<n><n>### Inputs: 1. How to write good paper<n>2. the last sentence of the paper should be what?<n><n>### Demostration: 1. Write a good paper 2. The paper would end with a sumamry<n><n>### Response to inputs<n>1. Write a paper:<n><n>#### What are good papers<n><n>Good papers is a paragraph that explains something about something. Good papers need to describe something with in its paragraph. Good papers can be about anything. The more details you put in your paper the better. If you put some random words in your paper your paper will look better.<n><n>**A good paragraph contains:**<n><n>- 2-5 sentences<n>- 1 main point<n>- 2-3 supporting details<n>- 1 transitional sentence to connect different sentences<n><n>#### How to write good paper?<n><n>In order to write a good paper you need have a topic and a main point and you also need to have supporting details and transitional sentence to connect those two sentences.<n>The main point is the big idea of the paragraph and its the point you are making in your paper. supporting details come after the main points and they support the main points to make them look more convincing and to give them more reasons to support your main point.<n>Transitional sentence are sentences that connect the main and the supporting sentence. They make your paragraph better and more convincing. The transitional sentence are important sentences because they make the sentence better and connect to other sentences to show that the paper is going to be about or show what the paragraphs points are about and the sentence are important in paragraphs.<n><n>You need to start your paragraph with a sentence that introduces your paper and you need to finish your paragraph with a sentence about the paper or the details in the paragraph its self to show that you have good details and points.<n>### Input

Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>Input: Jan wasn't very good at studying.  What might help him study better? Choices:  A: having a bigger brain B: headaches C: inspiration D: more intelligence E: understanding<n>Answer: D: more intelligence<n><n>Input: The cat was wild but like all others he was always read for a cat what? Choices:  A: stealing B: four legs C: tuna fish D: food now E: nap<n>Answer: E: nap<n><n>### Input:What planet is the atlantic ocean part of? Choices:  A: planet B: basin C: submarines D: earth E: pacific<n><n>### Response:		Answer C<n>### Instruction answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Input is a large body of water connecting several seas? Choices:  a: what is water b: what is ocean c: what is sea d: what is river<n>answer  b d<n><n>### Instuction: answer the followig multiple choice question<n><n><n># Write a script that uses the following task instructions to write a program<n>### Input question to answer<n>What is a fish?<n><n>Choices for Answer<n><n> A: water<n> B: a creature<n> C: meat<n> D: a cat<n> E: A, B, C, D, E<n><n>### Choice of fish to answer with<n><n>A fish in a pond is 5 feet long and lives in a stream 18 inches wide. If the fish is also to live in a river is the width of the river important to its survival?<n><n>### Description of code<n><n>In this script I wrote fish as, "A, B, C, or D or E" and the user gives me their choice.  I then check if the answer is one of <n> those listed in the answer and if it is return the index of the correct item, or return 0 if not. If the answer is not in those <n> choices a blank will display and the program will ask the user again to give them a different answer.  The program displays <n> the width of what the user chooses and adds 18 to to that number, then outputs that answer.<n><n>### Description<n>If a user inputs, "the question" above, then the program will ask them to make a selection.<n>- the user selects an option A, B or C <n>- the program asks the user to select an option D or E. If the user types in a new input then the program will re-loop<n><n> <n><n>### Code to run<n><n>```<n> 1:     Input the above question to the answer.<n> 2:     Select A, B, C or D or E from the list.  If a user types in <n> 3:     anything that is not a number, this will cause a blank <n> 4:     to be displayed and the program will ask for the user to <n> 5:     type in a number.<n> 6:     If the numbers chosen does not match what was given
